text: The 2017 European Badminton Championships were the 26th tournament of the European Badminton Championships. They were held in Kolding, Denmark, from 25–30 April 2017.http://www.badmintoneurope.com/cms/default.aspx?clubid=4685&cmsid;=239&pageid;=5381&m;=2425579 ==Medalists== {| |- |rowspan=2|Men's singles |rowspan=2| Rajiv Ouseph |rowspan=2| Anders Antonsen | Viktor Axelsen |- | Hans-Kristian Vittinghus |- |rowspan=2|Women's singles |rowspan=2| Carolina Marín |rowspan=2| Kirsty Gilmour | Mette Poulsen |- | Sabrina Jaquet |- |rowspan=2|Men's doubles |rowspan=2| Mathias Boe Carsten Mogensen |rowspan=2| Mads Conrad-Petersen Mads Pieler Kolding | Mathias Christiansen David Daugaard |- | Kim Astrup Anders Skaarup Rasmussen |- |rowspan=2|Women's doubles |rowspan=2| Kamilla Rytter Juhl Christinna Pedersen |rowspan=2| Gabriela Stoeva Stefani Stoeva | Anastasia Chervyakova Olga Morozova |- | Lauren Smith Sarah Walker |- |rowspan=2|Mixed doubles |rowspan=2| Chris Adcock Gabrielle Adcock |rowspan=2| Joachim Fischer Nielsen Christinna Pedersen | Sam Magee Chloe Magee |- | Ronan Labar Audrey Fontaine |- |} ==Men's singles== ===Seeds=== # Jacco Arends / Selena Piek (First Round) # Evgenij Dremin / Evgenia Dimova (Quarterfinals) # Vitalij Durkin / Nina Vislova (Second Round) # Nico Ruponen / Amanda Hogstrom (Quarterfinals) ===Wild card=== Badminton Europe (BEC) awarded a wild card entry to Søren Gravholt and Maiken Fruergaard of Denmark. === Top Half === === Bottom Half === === Finals === ==External links== *Official website ==References== Category:European Badminton Championships European Badminton Championships Category:International sports competitions hosted by Denmark Category:2017 in Danish sport Category:Badminton tournaments in Denmark
